newsitem.title: USA: U.K. cable bonds rally in U.S. on news of merger.
newsitem.headline: U.K. cable bonds rally in U.S. on news of merger.

text.p: High-yield bonds across the U.K. cable sector rallied on news of a merger of several large British cable and telecommunications companies, traders and analysts said on Tuesday.
The deal, which involves the merger of the British operations of Cable & Wireless Plc, NYNEX Corp of the U.S. and Bell Canada International, will create the largest cable operator in the U.K.
"Pricing on these bonds will hit the moon," said Alan Ginsberg, cable analyst and head of high-yield research at Smith Barney.
Zero coupon bonds of Bell Cablemedia Plc, Videotron Holdings Plc, Diamond Cable, International Cabletel and TeleWest rallied two to three points in early trade, market sources said.
"This merger will be a positive for bondholders because it will create a less leveraged company with a larger revenue base, more cash flow, and a better debt-to-cash flow ratio," says Ginsberg.
The Smith Barney analyst also contended the larger company will be better able to compete in the telephone market with British Telecom, the dominant telephone carrier in the U.K.
